intro: Deyeuxia deserticola, commonly known as the desert couchgrass, is a perennial grass species native to arid and semi-arid regions of Asia. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers, typical of the Poaceae family. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with deep root systems that help it survive in dry conditions. Deyeuxia deserticola plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing forage for livestock in its native habitats.
